TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit EndpointPermission extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines an endpoint that is authorized by a instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The EndpointPermission class defines a network endpoint, including host name, network port number, and transport type used to make the connection.
> [!NOTE] > Avoid creating EndPoint permissions using host names because these names will have to be resolved to IP address, which could block the stack.

Docs.summary: Gets the DNS host name or IP address of the server that is associated with this endpoint.
Docs.value: A string that contains the DNS host name or IP address of the server.

Docs.summary: Gets the network port number that is associated with this endpoint.
Docs.value: The network port number that is associated with this request, or .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string that represents the current instance.
Docs.returns: A string that represents the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ToString method returns a string that represents the contents for the <xref:System.Net.EndpointPermission> instance. The string is in the form <xref:System.Net.EndpointPermission.Hostname%2A> # <xref:System.Net.EndpointPermission.Port%2A> # <xref:System.Net.EndpointPermission.Transport%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the transport type that is associated with this endpoint.
